snippet: The court ruled, 5 to 4, that the IQ of a death row inmate — 75 — and his difficulties with learning raised reasonable doubts about his intellectual capacity.
abstract: Supreme court rules 5-4 that Louisiana death row inmate Kevan Brumfield is entitled to hearing to determine whether he is intellectually disabled, category that would bar him from execution; rules unanimously that prosecutors could use testimony of 3-year-old boy in case against Darius Clark; rules 5-4 against California death row inmate Hector Ayala who said prosecutors acted improperly in excluding all seven black and Hispanic potential jurors from his trial.
lead_paragraph: The court ruled, 5 to 4, that the IQ of a death row inmate — 75 — and his difficulties with learning raised reasonable doubts about his intellectual capacity.

headline.main: Supreme Court Permits New Hearing for Mentally Disabled Inmate
headline.print_headline: Justices Back New Hearing for Low-I.Q. Inmate
